SEARCH
Package io.papermc.paper.registry.data

Interface EnchantmentRegistryEntry.Builder

All Superinterfaces:
EnchantmentRegistryEntry, RegistryBuilder<Enchantment>
Enclosing interface:
EnchantmentRegistryEntry
@Experimental @NonExtendable public static interface EnchantmentRegistryEntry.Builder extends EnchantmentRegistryEntry, RegistryBuilder<Enchantment>
A mutable builder for the EnchantmentRegistryEntry plugins may change in applicable registry events.

The following values are required for each builder:

  • description(Component)
  • supportedItems(RegistryKeySet)
  • weight(int)
  • maxLevel(int)
  • minimumCost(EnchantmentCost)
  • maximumCost(EnchantmentCost)
  • anvilCost(int)
  • activeSlots(Iterable)

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface io.papermc.paper.registry.data.EnchantmentRegistryEntry

    EnchantmentRegistryEntry.Builder, EnchantmentRegistryEntry.EnchantmentCost

    Methods inherited from interface io.papermc.paper.registry.data.EnchantmentRegistryEntry

    activeSlots, anvilCost, description, exclusiveWith, maximumCost, maxLevel, minimumCost, primaryItems, supportedItems, weight

  • Method Details

    • description

      @Contract(value="_ -> this", mutates="this") EnchantmentRegistryEntry.Builder description(Component description)
      Configures the description of this enchantment entry as displayed to the client, e.g. "Sharpness" for the sharpness enchantment.
      Parameters:
      description - the description component.
      Returns:
      this builder instance.

    • supportedItems

      @Contract(value="_ -> this", mutates="this") EnchantmentRegistryEntry.Builder supportedItems(RegistryKeySet<ItemType> supportedItems)
      Configures the set of supported items this enchantment can be applied on. This can be a RegistryKeySet created via RegistrySet.keySet(io.papermc.paper.registry.RegistryKey, Iterable) or a tag obtained via RegistryFreezeEvent.getOrCreateTag(TagKey) with tag keys found in ItemTypeTagKeys such as ItemTypeTagKeys.ENCHANTABLE_ARMOR and ItemTypeTagKeys.ENCHANTABLE_SWORD.
      Parameters:
      supportedItems - the registry key set representing the supported items.
      Returns:
      this builder instance.
      See Also:
      • RegistrySet.keySet(RegistryKey, TypedKey[])
      • RegistryFreezeEvent.getOrCreateTag(TagKey)

    • primaryItems

      @Contract(value="_ -> this", mutates="this") EnchantmentRegistryEntry.Builder primaryItems(@Nullable RegistryKeySet<ItemType> primaryItems)
      Configures a set of item types this enchantment can naturally be applied to, when enchanting in an enchantment table.This can be a RegistryKeySet created via RegistrySet.keySet(io.papermc.paper.registry.RegistryKey, Iterable) or a tag obtained via RegistryFreezeEvent.getOrCreateTag(TagKey) with tag keys found in ItemTypeTagKeys such as ItemTypeTagKeys.ENCHANTABLE_ARMOR and ItemTypeTagKeys.ENCHANTABLE_SWORD.

      Defaults to null which means all EnchantmentRegistryEntry.supportedItems() are considered primary items. Additionally, the tag EnchantmentTagKeys.IN_ENCHANTING_TABLE defines which enchantments can even show up in an enchantment table.

      Parameters:
      primaryItems - the registry key set representing the primary items.
      Returns:
      this builder instance.
      See Also:
      • RegistrySet.keySet(RegistryKey, TypedKey[])
      • RegistryFreezeEvent.getOrCreateTag(TagKey)

    • weight

      @Contract(value="_ -> this", mutates="this") EnchantmentRegistryEntry.Builder weight(@org.jetbrains.annotations.Range(from=1L, to=1024L) int weight)
      Configures the weight of this enchantment used by the weighted random when selecting enchantments.
      Parameters:
      weight - the weight value.
      Returns:
      this builder instance.
      See Also:
      • https://minecraft.wiki/w/Enchanting for examplary weights.

    • maxLevel

      @Contract(value="_ -> this", mutates="this") EnchantmentRegistryEntry.Builder maxLevel(@org.jetbrains.annotations.Range(from=1L, to=255L) int maxLevel)
      Configures the maximum level this enchantment can have when applied.
      Parameters:
      maxLevel - the maximum level.
      Returns:
      this builder instance.

    • minimumCost

      @Contract(value="_ -> this", mutates="this") EnchantmentRegistryEntry.Builder minimumCost(EnchantmentRegistryEntry.EnchantmentCost minimumCost)
      Configures the minimum cost needed to enchant an item with this enchantment.

      Note that a cost is not directly related to the consumed xp.

      Parameters:
      minimumCost - the enchantment cost.
      Returns:
      this builder instance.
      See Also:
      • https://minecraft.wiki/w/Enchanting/Levels for examplary costs.

    • maximumCost

      @Contract(value="_ -> this", mutates="this") EnchantmentRegistryEntry.Builder maximumCost(EnchantmentRegistryEntry.EnchantmentCost maximumCost)
      Configures the maximum cost to enchant an item with this enchantment.

      Note that a cost is not directly related to the consumed xp.

      Parameters:
      maximumCost - the enchantment cost.
      Returns:
      this builder instance.
      See Also:
      • https://minecraft.wiki/w/Enchanting/Levels for examplary costs.

    • anvilCost

      @Contract(value="_ -> this", mutates="this") EnchantmentRegistryEntry.Builder anvilCost(@org.jetbrains.annotations.Range(from=0L, to=2147483647L) int anvilCost)
      Configures the cost of applying this enchantment using an anvil.

      Note that this is halved when using an enchantment book, and is multiplied by the level of the enchantment. See https://minecraft.wiki/w/Anvil_mechanics for more information.

      Parameters:
      anvilCost - the anvil cost of this enchantment
      Returns:
      this builder instance.
      See Also:
      • Enchantment.getAnvilCost()

    • activeSlots

      @Contract(value="_ -> this", mutates="this") default EnchantmentRegistryEntry.Builder activeSlots(EquipmentSlotGroup... activeSlots)
      Configures the list of slot groups this enchantment may be active in.

      If the item enchanted with this enchantment is equipped in a slot not covered by the returned list and its groups, the enchantment's effects, like attribute modifiers, will not activate.

      Parameters:
      activeSlots - a list of equipment slot groups.
      Returns:
      this builder instance.
      See Also:
      • Enchantment.getActiveSlotGroups()

    • activeSlots

      @Contract(value="_ -> this", mutates="this") EnchantmentRegistryEntry.Builder activeSlots(Iterable<EquipmentSlotGroup> activeSlots)
      Configures the list of slot groups this enchantment may be active in.

      If the item enchanted with this enchantment is equipped in a slot not covered by the returned list and its groups, the enchantment's effects, like attribute modifiers, will not activate.

      Parameters:
      activeSlots - a list of equipment slot groups.
      Returns:
      this builder instance.
      See Also:
      • Enchantment.getActiveSlotGroups()

    • exclusiveWith

      @Contract(value="_ -> this", mutates="this") EnchantmentRegistryEntry.Builder exclusiveWith(RegistryKeySet<Enchantment> exclusiveWith)
      Configures the registry key set of enchantments that this enchantment is exclusive with.

      Exclusive enchantments prohibit the application of this enchantment to an item if they are already present on said item.

      Defaults to an empty set allowing this enchantment to be applied regardless of other enchantments.

      Parameters:
      exclusiveWith - a registry set of enchantments exclusive to this one.
      Returns:
      this builder instance.
      See Also:
      • RegistrySet.keySet(RegistryKey, TypedKey[])
      • RegistryFreezeEvent.getOrCreateTag(TagKey)
